Package org.neo4j.io.pagecache.impl.muninn

Class OffHeapPageLock

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.io.pagecache.impl.muninn.OffHeapPageLock
  • public final class OffHeapPageLock
extends Object
    OffHeapPageLock is a sequence-based lock like StampedLock, but entirely non-blocking, and with special lock modes that are needed by the Muninn page cache.

    The OffHeapPageLock supports non-blocking optimistic concurrent read locks, non-blocking concurrent write locks, and non-blocking pessimistic flush and exclusive locks.

    The optimistic read lock works through validation, so at the end of the critical section, the read lock has to be validated and, if the validation fails, the critical section has to be retried. The read-lock acquires a stamp at the start of the critical section, which is then validated at the end of the critical section. The stamp is invalidated if any write lock or exclusive lock was overlapping with the read lock.

    The concurrent write locks works by assuming that writes are always non-conflicting, so no validation is required. However, the write locks will check if a pessimistic exclusive lock is held at the start of the critical section, and if so, fail to be acquired. The write locks will invalidate all optimistic read locks. The write lock is try-lock only, and will never block. A successfully taken write lock will raise the modified bit, if it is not already raised. When the modified bit is raised, isModified(long) will return true.

    The flush lock is also non-blocking (try-lock only), but can only be held by one thread at a time for implementation reasons. The flush lock is meant for flushing the data in a page. This means that flush locks do not invalidate optimistic read locks, nor does it prevent overlapping write locks. However, it does prevent other overlapping flush and exclusive locks. Likewise, if another flush or exclusive lock is held, the attempt to take the flush lock will fail. The release of the flush lock will lower the modified bit if, and only if, it was not overlapping with any write lock and the flush lock release method was given a success flag. The success flag is necessary because the flush operation itself is an IO operation that may fail for any number of reasons.

    The exclusive lock will also invalidate the optimistic read locks. The exclusive lock is try-lock only, and will never block. If a write or flush lock is currently held, the attempt to take the exclusive lock will fail, and the exclusive lock will likewise prevent write and flush locks from being taken.

    Because all lock types are non-blocking, and because the lock-word itself is external to the implementation, this class does not need to maintain any state by itself. Thus, the class cannot be instantiated, and all methods are static.

    Note that the lock-word is assumed to be 8 bytes, and should ideally be aligned to 8-byte boundaries, and ideally run on platforms that support 8-byte-wide atomic memory operations.

      • initialLockWordWithExclusiveLock

        public static long initialLockWordWithExclusiveLock()
        Returns:
        A newly initialised lock word, for a lock that is exclusively locked.

      • tryOptimisticReadLock

        public static long tryOptimisticReadLock​(long address)
        Start an optimistic critical section, and return a stamp that can be used to validate if the read lock was consistent. That is, if no write or exclusive lock was overlapping with the optimistic read lock.
        Returns:
        A stamp that must be passed to validateReadLock(long, long) to validate the critical section.

      • validateReadLock

        public static boolean validateReadLock​(long address,
                                       long stamp)
        Validate a stamp from tryOptimisticReadLock(long) or unlockExclusive(long), and return true if no write or exclusive lock overlapped with the critical section of the optimistic read lock represented by the stamp.
        Parameters:
        stamp - The stamp of the optimistic read lock.
        Returns:
        true if the optimistic read lock was valid, false otherwise.

      • isModified

        public static boolean isModified​(long address)

      • isExclusivelyLocked

        public static boolean isExclusivelyLocked​(long address)

      • tryWriteLock

        public static boolean tryWriteLock​(long address)
        Try taking a concurrent write lock. Multiple write locks can be held at the same time. Write locks will invalidate any optimistic read lock that overlaps with them, and write locks will make any attempt at grabbing an exclusive lock fail. If an exclusive lock is currently held, then the attempt to take a write lock will fail.

        Write locks must be paired with a corresponding unlockWrite(long).

        Returns:
        true if the write lock was taken, false otherwise.

      • failWriteLock

        private static boolean failWriteLock​(long s,
                                     boolean writeCountOverflow)

      • throwWriteLockOverflow

        private static void throwWriteLockOverflow​(long s)

      • unlockWrite

        public static void unlockWrite​(long address)
        Release a write lock taking with tryWriteLock(long).

      • throwUnmatchedUnlockWrite

        private static void throwUnmatchedUnlockWrite​(long s)

      • nextSeq

        private static long nextSeq​(long s)

      • unlockWriteAndTryTakeFlushLock

        public static long unlockWriteAndTryTakeFlushLock​(long address)

      • tryExclusiveLock

        public static boolean tryExclusiveLock​(long address)
        Grab the exclusive lock if it is immediately available. Exclusive locks will invalidate any overlapping optimistic read lock, and fail write and flush locks. If any write or flush locks are currently taken, or if the exclusive lock is already taken, then the attempt to grab an exclusive lock will fail.

        Successfully grabbed exclusive locks must always be paired with a corresponding unlockExclusive(long).

        Returns:
        true if we successfully got the exclusive lock, false otherwise.

      • unlockExclusive

        public static long unlockExclusive​(long address)
        Unlock the currently held exclusive lock, and atomically and implicitly take an optimistic read lock, as represented by the returned stamp.
        Returns:
        A stamp that represents an optimistic read lock, in case you need it.

      • unlockExclusiveAndTakeWriteLock

        public static void unlockExclusiveAndTakeWriteLock​(long address)
        Atomically unlock the currently held exclusive lock, and take a write lock.

      • initiateExclusiveLockRelease

        private static long initiateExclusiveLockRelease​(long address)

      • throwUnmatchedUnlockExclusive

        private static void throwUnmatchedUnlockExclusive​(long s)

      • explicitlyMarkPageUnmodifiedUnderExclusiveLock

        public static void explicitlyMarkPageUnmodifiedUnderExclusiveLock​(long address)
        If the given lock is exclusively held, then the modified flag will be explicitly lowered (marked as unmodified) if the modified is currently raised.

        If the modified flag is currently not raised, then this method does nothing.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the lock at the given address is not in the exclusively locked state.

      • tryFlushLock

        public static long tryFlushLock​(long address)
        Grab the flush lock if it is immediately available. Flush locks prevent overlapping exclusive locks, but do not invalidate optimistic read locks, nor do they prevent overlapping write locks. Only one flush lock can be held at a time. If any flush or exclusive lock is already held, the attempt to take the flush lock will fail.

        Successfully grabbed flush locks must always be paired with a corresponding unlockFlush(long, long, boolean).

        Returns:
        If the lock is successfully grabbed, the method will return a stamp value that must be passed to the unlockFlush(long, long, boolean), and which is used for detecting any overlapping write locks. If the flush lock could not be taken, 0 will be returned.

      • unlockFlush

        public static void unlockFlush​(long address,
                               long stamp,
                               boolean success)
        Unlock the currently held flush lock.

      • throwUnmatchedUnlockFlush

        private static void throwUnmatchedUnlockFlush​(long s)

        private static String describeState​(long s)
